1.brief: to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)
Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
properly, a pithy maxim, usually of metaphorical nature; hence, a simile (as an adage, poem, discourse)

2.brief: alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
to be (causatively, make) bitter (literally or figuratively)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
a puff, i.e. wind, angry or vital breath, divine inspiration, intellect. or (concretely) an animal

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire

4.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to murmur (in pleasure or anger); by implication, to ponder

5.brief: literal fora profaned thing; used (interj.) far be it!
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to be (causatively, make) right (in a moral or forensic sense)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
to breathe out, i.e. (by implication) expire
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

6.brief: rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to slacken (in many applications, literal or figurative)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to pull off, i.e. (by implication) to expose (as by stripping); specifically, to betroth (as if a surrender); figuratively, to carp at, i.e. defame; to spend the winter
the heart (as the most interior organ);
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

7.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)

8.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
literally a cord (as an attachment); figuratively, expectancy
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to draw out or off, i.e. remove (the soul by death)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

9.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:

10.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to be soft or pliable, i.e. (figuratively) effeminate or luxurious
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.

11.brief: properly, to flow as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to lay or throw (especially an arrow, i.e. to shoot); figuratively, to point out (as if by aiming the finger), to teach
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to secrete, by act or word; hence (intensively) to destroy

12.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have avision of

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb
to be vain in act, word, or expectation; specifically to lead astray

13.brief: the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
properly, smoothness (of the tongue); also an allotment
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion
to take (in the widest variety of applications)

14.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)

15.brief: death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
a widow; also a desolate place
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

16.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
properly, a bubbling up, i.e. of water, a wave; of earth, mire or clay (cement); also a heap; hence, a chomer or dry measure

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)

17.brief: properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate

18.brief: a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)

19.brief: to lie down (for rest, sexual connection, decease or any other purpose)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to open (the senses, especially the eyes); figuratively, to be observant
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

20.brief: water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
to thieve (literally or figuratively); by implication, to deceive

21.brief: to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
the fore or front part; hence (by orientation) the East (often adverbially, eastward, for brevity the east wind)
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
to storm; by implication, to shiver, i.e. fear
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)

22.brief: to throw out, down or away (literally or figuratively)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to commiserate; by implication, to spare
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to bolt, i.e. figuratively, to flee suddenly
to bolt, i.e. figuratively, to flee suddenly

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

properly, to be shrill, i.e. to whistle or hiss (as a call or in scorn)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
